intro: Malcolmia laxa var. stenopetala, commonly known as narrow-petaled malcolmia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
